column4: any ideas on how to make ubuntu 11.10 grub working on EFI laptop, or... can I use windows 7 boot loader to chainload grub somehow?
running apt-get upgrade now, maybe that's what's at fault here
the problem is, no matter where i install grub (grub-install --boot-directory=/boot /dev/sda, or /dev/sda1 or what not, it never ever tries to load grub
Again, you have to use the GRUB from the grub-efi package, not the normal one
the solution: install grub-pc instead of the autodetected grub-efi !!
it seems to me that not all "EFI" systems are booting with EFI
True enough, I have a computer with something called "Insyde EFI H20" on it, that is, infact, a BIOS.
but what is even more confusing is that many ppl on the net have used grub-efi specifically to make oneiric work on this very model
/var full maybe? You sure logrotate is installed?
Hmm... Any output when you start it manually as in "sudo service rsyslogd start"?
Ah then probably something wrong with the config file in /etc/init/
reboot helped, not nice, fortunately this was not in production
